      int[] partition(HGraph g, int k, java.util.Hashtable props)
      returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)
      void setObjectiveFunction(HObjFncIntf f)

        public int[] partition(HGraph g,
              int k,
              java.util.Hashtable props)
        returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)

      • bestPartOld

        private int bestPartOld(HGraph g,
              int k,
              int[] partition,
              HNode ni,
              java.util.Hashtable props)
        find the best partition that node ni can go to, or -1 if constraints are violated by this move. Also sets the best gain found in _gain.
        Parameters:
        g - HGraph
        k - int
        partition - int[]
        ni - HNode
        props - Hashtable
        Returns:
        int the partition block to move ni, or -1 else

      • othersInPartition

        private int othersInPartition(HLink l,
                    HNode n,
                    int[] partition)
        returns -1 if the link l does not have all nodes except n in a single partition. Else, it returns that other partition's id.
        Parameters:
        l - HLink
        n - HNode
        partition - int[]
        Returns:
        int
